definition: eyes brimming with tears of excitement (idiom)/extremely moved
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: With tear-filled eyes, I turned the machine off.
sentences.chinese: 我熱淚盈眶地關掉了電腦。

sentences.english: The rear passenger compartment alone is enough to make experienced cops get teary-eyed.
sentences.chinese: 單是後乘客室就足以令有經驗的警察感動地熱淚盈眶。

sentences.english: eg: At this point all of us were burst into tears.
sentences.chinese: 此時我們所有人都熱淚盈眶。

sentences.english: Poor Shin had me in tears watching her.
sentences.chinese: 可憐的申雅嵐讓我在電視前熱淚盈眶。

sentences.english: The green lawns brought tears to my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 看着眼前綠茵茵的草坪，我不禁熱淚盈眶。

sentences.english: I watched it carefully, tear in eye.
Seeing those tiny bones brought her to tears.
sentences.chinese: 看着這些纖細的骨頭，她激動地熱淚盈眶。

sentences.english: The water stood in my eyes to hear this avowal of his dependence;
sentences.chinese: 聽完他表示對別人的依賴，我不禁熱淚盈眶。

sentences.english: Status Offline The rear passenger compartment alone is enough to make experienced cops get teary-eyed.
sentences.chinese: 單是後乘客室就足以令有經驗的警察感動地熱淚盈眶。

sentences.english: It's the kind of movie that can make you laugh with tears in your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 它是那種能夠使你面帶笑容卻又熱淚盈眶的影片。

sentences.english: But I was young and foolish, and now i m full of tears.
sentences.chinese: 但我當年年幼無知，而今熱淚盈眶。

sentences.english: So happy was she at the news that tears gathered in her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她聽到那個消息很高興以至於熱淚盈眶。

sentences.english: The football players disolved into tears at their victory.
sentences.chinese: 足球隊員因獲勝而熱淚盈眶。

sentences.english: It’s the kind of moive that can make you laugh with tears in your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 它是那種能夠使你面帶笑容卻又熱淚盈眶的影片。

sentences.english: The news he succeeded in the game drought us to tears.
sentences.chinese: 他在比賽中獲勝的消息使我們熱淚盈眶。

sentences.english: Of these, the women wore moved to tears.
sentences.chinese: 這些，使女兵娘倆感動得熱淚盈眶。

definition: to be fired up (idiom)/to have one's blood racing
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to remain fresh in one's memory (idiom)
(haven't done sth) for a long time/a long time since we last met
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
